intro: Dampiera stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stamen dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal or inland regions with a temperate climate. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. Dampiera stenostachya is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
